isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 2000 4000 and 8000 MODELS BUILT OCTOBER 1, 1998 AND AFTER - ALLISON WT TRANSMISSION WITH WTEC III ELECTRONIC CONTROLS - TROUBLESHOOTING - TROUBLESHOOTING PROCESS

important.para: Review " BEFORE BEGINNING TROUBLESHOOTING" located above.

step1.para: When beginning the troubleshooting process, check for diagnostic codes using either:

step2.para: Record all information relating to the logged diagnostic codes. If using the Pro-Link, also note and record the number of occurrences for each code. If not using an electronic service tool, "Clear" codes from memory.

step1.para: Test drive vehicle to confirm code or performance complaint.

step2.para: If the code is active after the test drive, refer to TROUBLESHOOTING WITH DIAGNOSTIC CODES following, for the appropriate test procedure.

If the code is not "active" after the test drive, it may have been a momentary problem. If the diagnosis is being performed with an electronic service tool, note the number of occurrences for the code. If the number of occurrences indicates that the code has been registered several times, perform the diagnostics for the diagnostic code and concentrate on problem areas that could create an intermittent condition.

step1.para: If diagnostic codes are present that are not covered in this manual, perform the checks identified in BEFORE BEGINNING TROUBLESHOOTING (above). If no defects are noted that resolve the condition, have an Allison dealer diagnose the vehicle.
